The source of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim was made in an image that was posted on Facebook on November 4, 2018. This indicates that the source of the claim can be traced back to a specific social media post.
Attribution to Clint Eastwood: The claim attributes a quote to Clint Eastwood, stating that he said, "one day we will realize that the Barack Obama presidency was the biggest fraud ever perpetrated on the American people." The expert's verdict confirms that Clint Eastwood did make similar comments about Obama, although the wording may not be an exact match.
Verification through a local newspaper: The expert's verdict references a newspaper called the Carmel Pine Cone, which published a story on September 7, 2012, quoting Clint Eastwood as saying, "President Obama is the greatest hoax ever perpetrated on the American people." This verifies that Eastwood did express negative views about Obama, although the specific quote mentioned in the claim may not be accurate.
Confirmation by Donald Trump: The expert's verdict mentions that three days after the Carmel Pine Cone story ran, Donald Trump tweeted a similar statement attributed to Clint Eastwood, saying, "‘President Obama is the greatest hoax ever perpetrated on the American people.’ --Clint Eastwood." This confirms that Eastwood's comments align with the sentiment expressed in the claim, although the wording may vary slightly.
